conversations.question:
Hello Matt,

Earlier I was able to see the terminal and check the tests, but now the terminal isn't showing up at the bottom of the editor. I've tried switching browser from Brave to Chrome and resizing on laptop, monitors etc. but nothing worked.
Attached screenshot above.

Can you please help fix this or if it's only an issue on my end, let me know how to get this fixed.

Regards,
Yatin
conversations.answer:
Hi Yatin,
The terminal not showing in the editor is usually a display issue. A few things to try:

Clear your browser cache and refresh the page

Check if the terminal panel is collapsed - look for a divider/handle at the bottom of the editor you can drag up to expand it

Try incognito/private browsing mode to rule out browser extensions interfering

If none of that works, let me know which specific problem page you're on and I'll investigate further.
conversations.subject: Re: Editor issue on Problems page

you please help here?

Arpan
conversations.answer:
Hi Arpan,
The browser terminal issue usually clears with a hard refresh. Try Ctrl+Shift+R (or Cmd+Shift+R on Mac) to clear your cache and reload the page.
If that doesn't work, let me know which exercise you're trying to run and I'll dig into what might be blocking it.

conversations.subject: Re: Matt, enquiry

conversations.question:
Hello,

I hope you‚Äôre doing well.

I have an active Total TypeScript account that I personally no longer use.
I understand from your policy that accounts and licenses normally aren‚Äôt
transferable, and I completely respect that.

Before letting it go unused, I just wanted to ask whether there‚Äôs *any*
possibility of transferring the account to another person as a one-off
exception, potentially for a small administrative fee if that helps.

If this isn‚Äôt something you support under any circumstances, no worries at
all. I just wanted to check before giving up on it entirely.

Thanks for your time, and for the great TypeScript content you put out.

Best regards,

Pontus Abrahamsson
conversations.answer:
Hi Pontus,
Thanks for asking. Account transfers aren't something we support, even as a one-off exception. The license is tied to your account and email.
However, you have a couple of alternatives: you could gift the account by changing the email address to theirs (we'd process that as an email change), or they could purchase their own license. If cost is a concern for them, we occasionally run promotions.
Which option works better for your situation?
conversations.subject: Re: Question about possible account transfer

conversations.subject: Re: New Course: Responsible AI Engineering

conversations.question:
Hi Total TypeScript team üëã

I‚Äôve been using the course on your website for months now and something odd popped up a couple of days ago.

For some reason, I no longer see the console/output section under the exercises ‚Äî the part where you normally see whether tests are passing or failing, logs, etc. It used to be there automatically and I didn‚Äôt change anything (at least not intentionally üòÖ).

I‚Äôve tried looking around for a setting or toggle to bring it back, but no luck so far. So before I blame myself entirely, I thought I‚Äôd ask: could this be a bug on your side, or am I just missing something obvious?

Happy to provide more details if needed.
Thanks a lot ‚Äî I‚Äôm really enjoying the course otherwise!

Best,
Barnabas
conversations.answer:
Hi Barnabas,
The console panel should be visible by default in the exercise interface. A few things to try:

Hard refresh your browser (Ctrl+Shift+R on Windows/Linux, or Cmd+Shift+R on Mac) to clear any cached UI state

Check if you're using a different browser or device than usual

If you're on a smaller screen, the console might be collapsed at the bottom - look for a toggle or resize handle

If none of that works, let me know which exercise you're seeing this on and I'll investigate further.
conversations.subject: Re: Console panel missing in exercises

conversations.question:
Hey there,

I have a potential bug report below:

I don't know if something changed in StackBlitz embedding API, but it's not
showing errors in the code any more and I am getting errors in the console
that may be relevant

[image: image.png]

[image: image.png]
I seem to be noticing double scroll bars as well - i think the stackblitz
window was limited to viewport height before.

I don't recall if the bottom bar was there before, but it shows up now,
and...
[image: image.png]

...when I click on the "Fork on StackBlitz" button at the bottom, the file
shows up properly and shows all the TS errors.
Not a blocker since I can still work on files locally and use the "fork on
StackBlitz" function, but it does make it more clunky.

Thanks in advance for looking into it!

Greg
conversations.answer:
Hi Greg,
Thanks for the detailed report with screenshots. This sounds like a StackBlitz embedding issue on our end. A few questions to help us track this down:

Which lesson/module in Total TypeScript Pro Essentials are you seeing this in?

What browser and OS are you using?

Did this start happening recently, or has it been like this since you started the course?

Once we have those details, we can investigate whether something changed with how we're embedding StackBlitz or if it's a StackBlitz API change on their side.
conversations.subject: Re: Something changed in StackBlitz setup in TotalTypescript Pro Essentials?
